original_reasoning:
Okay, let's see. The user provided a C# program that's using RestSharp, and they need me to fill in the missing code. The task is to complete the RestClientDemo class so that it runs correctly.

Looking at the code, the first TODO is where they create the RestClient instance. The comment says to use the base URL. So I remember that the RestClient constructor takes the base URL as a parameter. The example usually uses something like "https://api.example.com" as a base URL. Since the user didn't specify a particular URL, I should use a placeholder here. Probably, the line should be new RestClient("https://api.example.com") or similar. Let me check the RestSharp documentation to confirm. Yes, the RestClient is initialized with the base URL. So the missing line is var client = new RestClient("https://api.example.com"); or maybe another URL, but the exact URL isn't specified, so the standard example would use that.

Then, the rest of the code seems okay. The GET request uses a route with {id} and adds the parameter correctly. The POST adds a JSON body. The execution lines are correct. So the only missing part is the RestClient instantiation. I think that's all. I'll make sure not to include anything else. The user wants only the missing code, so just the line for the client variable.
